poem:
Title: Beyond Borders, Beyond War

Such a red wheelbarrow 
agnostic of rain,
now heavy with rifts
in Gaza's hale.
In the land 
where olives once danced,
echoes of a ceasefire,
a possible, precious trance.
Sprung from Guterres' lips, 
hope mists over Jordan,
sailing past indifference 
and old alliances worn.
From UN's humble courtyard,
may peace be reborn.
